Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionPaymentReconciliation_Allocation
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.PaymentReconciliation.allocation` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`PaymentReconciliation.allocation` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `PaymentReconciliation.detail` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `PaymentReconciliation.detail` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PaymentReconciliation.detail`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: Distribution of the payment amount for a previously acknowledged payable.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Business identifier of the payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the current payment item for the referenced payable.
element.requirements:
Needed for reconciliation of payments. Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.identifier` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.identifier` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PaymentReconciliation.detail.identifier`, but has no comparisons.

element.requirements:
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.target` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.
Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.target` with an unmapped Reference type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-reference`.
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.target` has a context of PaymentReconciliation.detail based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `PaymentReconciliation`.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: The party which is receiving the payment.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The monetary amount allocated from the total payment to the payable.
element.requirements:
Needed to explain the distribution of the payment to the payables. Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.amount` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.amount` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PaymentReconciliation.detail.amount`, but has no comparisons.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: Distribution of the payment amount for a previously acknowledged payable.

element.short: Business identifier of the payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the current payment item for the referenced payable.
element.requirements:
Needed for reconciliation of payments. Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.identifier` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.identifier` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PaymentReconciliation.detail.identifier`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Business identifier of the payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the current payment item for the referenced payable.

element.short: Business identifier of the prior payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the prior payment item for the referenced payable.
element.requirements:
Needed for reconciliation of payments. Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.predecessor` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.predecessor` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `PaymentReconciliation.detail.predecessor`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Business identifier of the prior payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the prior payment item for the referenced payable.
Specific resource to which the payment/adjustment/advance applies.
element.requirements:
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.target` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.
Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.target` with an unmapped Reference type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-reference`.
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.target` has a context of PaymentReconciliation.detail based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `PaymentReconciliation`.

element.definition: Specific resource to which the payment/adjustment/advance applies.
Identifies the claim line item, encounter or other sub-element being paid. Note payment may be partial, that is not match the then outstanding balance or amount incurred.
element.requirements:
Element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation.targetItem[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `PaymentReconciliation.allocation` requires a cross-version extension.

element.definition: Identifies the claim line item, encounter or other sub-element being paid. Note payment may be partial, that is not match the then outstanding balance or amount incurred.

element.definition: The Encounter to which this payment applies, may be completed by the receiver, used for search.
